job_title: Adjunct Instructor in New Britain, CT
pros: Extremely friendly and helpful staff and faculty. Flexible, work from nearly anywhere, asynchronous instruction. Excellent support and course design with the invitation to provide input and feedback for continual improvement. Wonderful interaction with students that are eager to learn and succeed.
cons: Recent consolidation within the State of Connecticut government and Connecticut State Colleges and Universities system office have made some departments and functions slower and much less efficient. An inherently bureaucratic environment has become even more so. Not really at Charter Oak State College, but more so with the supporting infrastructure at the state and system level.

review_title: Poorly compensated for high levels of stress, disorganization and mismanagement
pros: State job, well-intentioned staff and good students.
cons: High stress created by poor management. There is very low employee morale which results in low productivity and too much time spent on internal conflicts and unclear expectations.  Highly talented staff are poorly managed. Very little opportunity for growth within the organization. Problems are not addressed proactively but allowed to grow. This is an extremely unpleasant work place with very little emphasis on quality or creativity. Staff are increasingly being expected to do more with less and support staff are treated with extreme lack of respect and consideration. Many complaints against supervisors have been filed in recent years.

pros: Knowing that you are helping students gives a sense of accomplishment for your hard work. The expectations of higher management are both firm and gentle, ensuring you will be challenged, but not unreasonably so.
cons: When deadlines come around, pressure can sometimes reach a boiling point and management loses their cool. Also some behind-the-scenes drama that doesn't help anyone.
